content.description:
The following questions refer to this passage:

lucundum, mea vita, mihi proponis amorem
 hunc nostrum inter nos perpetuumque fore.
Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit,
 atque id sincere dicat et ex animo.
content.question: Referring specifically to the Latin in lines 1-2 (Iucundum . . . fore), identify two characteristics of the love proposed by the addressee to Catullus.

frqParts.text: Referring specifically to the Latin in lines 1-2 (Iucundum . . . fore), identify two characteristics of the love proposed by the addressee to Catullus.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
